unnormalised: ICICI Bank just announced a new feature on their iMobile app – instant personal loans up to Rs. 5 lakh! You know, for those unexpected expenses, like that trip to Goa you've been planning or maybe even finally fixing that leaky roof before the monsoon hits. Seems pretty convenient, right?
normalised: I-C-I-C-I Bank just announced a new feature on their i-Mobile app – instant personal loans up to rupee five lakh! You know, for those unexpected expenses, like that trip to Goa you've been planning or maybe even finally fixing that leaky roof before the monsoon hits. Seems pretty convenient, right?

unnormalised: Apparently, you can get the loan disbursed directly into your account within 3 seconds. No need to visit the branch and fill out a million forms. Plus, they're saying the interest rates start at just 10.5% p.a. though, of course, that depends on your credit score and all that jazz. Make sure you read the fine print, okay?
normalised: Apparently, you can get the loan disbursed directly into your account within three seconds. No need to visit the branch and fill out a million forms. Plus, they're saying the interest rates start at just ten point five percent p.a. though, of course, that depends on your credit score and all that jazz. Make sure you read the fine print, okay?

unnormalised: They also mentioned something about simplifying UPI transactions. Now you can set recurring payments for your subscriptions and bills directly through the app, which will save us all some time. I wonder if other banks will come up with something similar too? Competition is good for us consumers.
normalised: They also mentioned something about simplifying U-P-I transactions. Now you can set recurring payments for your subscriptions and bills directly through the app, which will save us all some time. I wonder if other banks will come up with something similar too? Competition is good for us consumers.
